definition: to settle (a dispute)/to quieten down/to suppress
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]
surname Ping
breath/news/interest (on an investment or loan)/to cease/to stop/to rest/Taiwan pr. [xi2]

sentences.english: It is not just about assuaging your conscience.
sentences.chinese: 這不僅是有關平息你的良心。

sentences.english: One cannot overlook his uncanny ability to navigate the many political intrigues and maneuverings.
sentences.chinese: 沒人能忽略他平息各種政治陰謀詭計的稟賦。

sentences.english: The focus on China comes on a quiet day for domestic news.
sentences.chinese: 對中國的關注會因爲美國國內新聞而平息下來。

sentences.english: Ultimately, of course, the birth-order debate will never be entirely settled.
sentences.chinese: 最後，當然對於出生順序的爭論將永遠不會完全平息。

sentences.english: Sometimes a mediated conversation will straighten things out, and a little discussion and apology can calm the waters.
sentences.chinese: 有時調解可以弄清真相，討論和道歉能平息風波。

sentences.english: Rumours are rumours. It will soon blow over.
sentences.chinese: 流言終歸是流言，不久就會平息。

sentences.english: Up to 100 people have been killed in the unrest which shows no sign of subsiding.
sentences.chinese: 多達100在看不到平息下來的動盪中死亡。

sentences.english: Or is it simply a move to appease its critics?
sentences.chinese: 或者說此舉只是爲了平息對它的批評？

sentences.english: The rate cuts will soothe a little bit of jangled nerves at this time.
sentences.chinese: 這時降息可以稍稍平息人們雜亂的神經。

sentences.english: Now the angry fans and media have subsided.
sentences.chinese: 現在影迷和媒體的憤怒都已經平息。

sentences.english: Leading troops, he quelled a rebellion.
sentences.chinese: 他帶領軍隊平息了一場叛亂。

sentences.english: Our interest rate is as low as 0. 4% flat per month.
sentences.chinese: 我們的利率月息低至平息四釐。

sentences.english: If you ignore it, the situation will blow over soon.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不理它，這種狀況很快就會平息了。

sentences.english: The sea has gone down some.
When you’ve fully faced fear and experienced it, the fear will subside.
sentences.chinese: 當你直面恐懼，適應它，恐懼就會平息下來。

definition: to pacify/to calm down/to be cured/to be healed
disturbance/riot/to create a disturbance
to placate/to pacify/to appease
(literary) to eliminate/to put an end to
riot/rebellion/revolt
to ease (tension)/to alleviate/to moderate/to allay/to make more mild
disturbance/crisis/disputes/restlessness/CL:場|场[chang2]
tranquil/undisturbed/serene
to arise again/to make a comeback/resurgence
turmoil/upheaval/unrest
Anting township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
stable/quiet/settled/stabilize/maintain/stabilized/calm and orderly
to reconcile/to mediate/to bring warring parties to agreement/to arbitrate
rage/fury/hot anger
unrest (social or political)/turmoil/upheaval/commotion
to arouse/to evoke/to cause/to stir up
lit. lay down the flag and still the drums (idiom); fig. to cease/to give in
